paragraph.content: providing for the keeping of a register of the persons referred to in paragraph (ja)(i) and for the alteration to the register; (Added 2 of 2015 s. 23)

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: providing for the regulation of the type of containers in which various poisons or pharmaceutical products or classes of poisons or pharmaceutical products may be stored or sold and for the labelling of containers in which such poisons or pharmaceutical products are sold; (Amended 2 of 2015 s. 23)

paragraph.name: l
paragraph.content: providing for the regulating of the storage and transport of medicines and poisons;

paragraph.name: m
paragraph.content: prescribing fees for the licensing of wholesale dealers in poisons or pharmaceutical products and of manufacturers; (Amended 2 of 2015 s. 23)

paragraph.name: o
paragraph.content: generally providing for the regulating and controlling of the selling, purchasing, compounding and dispensing of poisons and medicines; (Amended 31 of 1972 s. 6)

paragraph.name: p
q
paragraph.content: providing for the registration and renewal of registration of pharmaceutical products manufactured in or imported into Hong Kong and for the payment of fees in respect thereof (including the fees payable for carrying out inspections for determining an application for such registration and renewal of registration), for the deregistration, suspension or variation of conditions of such registration, for the issue of warning letters to holders of registration certificates, and for appeals against a refusal, deregistration, suspension or variation of conditions of such registration or issue of warning letters; (Replaced 50 of 1980 s. 7. Amended 2 of 2015 s. 23)

paragraph.name: qa
paragraph.content: providing for the provisional registration of pharmaceutical products and for the issue of certificates and duplicate certificates and the payment of fees in respect thereof; (Added 50 of 1980 s. 7. Amended 2 of 2015 s. 23)

paragraph.name: qb
paragraph.content: providing for the control of the conduct of clinical trials on human beings and medicinal tests on animals, for the issue of clinical trial certificates and medicinal test certificates, for the cancellation, suspension or variation of conditions of such certificates, for the issue of warning letters to holders of such certificates, for appeals against a refusal, cancellation, suspension or variation of conditions of such certificates or issue of warning letters, and for the payment of fees in respect of the application for conducting such trials or tests and the issue of such certificates; (Replaced 2 of 2015 s. 23)

paragraph.name: r
s
paragraph.content: prescribing matters required or permitted to be prescribed by this Ordinance; (Added 2 of 2015 s. 23)

paragraph.name: t
paragraph.content: providing for the specification of forms for the purposes of the regulations; (Added 2 of 2015 s. 23)

paragraph.name: u
paragraph.content: making the incidental, consequential, evidential, transitional, savings and supplemental provisions necessary or expedient for giving full effect to the provisions of this Ordinance; and (Added 2 of 2015 s. 23)

paragraph.name: v
paragraph.content: generally providing for the better carrying out of the provisions and purposes of this Ordinance. (Added 2 of 2015 s. 23)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: Any regulations made under subsection (1)(aa) may prescribe different fees to be payable by different categories of pharmacists. (Added 50 of 1977 s. 6)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.leadIn: Despite subsection (1), the Board may, subject to the approval of the Secretary for Health and section 31, by regulation, amend— (Amended L.N. 144 of 2022)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Poisons List; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: any list, in a regulation made under subsection (1), of any substances or articles—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to which a provision in this Ordinance applies; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: which are exempt from any such provision. (Added 2 of 2015 s. 23)

subsection.content: A regulation made under this section may provide that a contravention thereof shall be an offence and may prescribe penalties for such offence not exceeding the penalties specified in section 34. (Added 45 of 1975 s. 2)

section.name: s29A
section.heading: Power of Board to specify forms

subsection.content: The Board may specify forms to be used for any provision of this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: If a form is specified under this section, the Board must make copies of the form available for inspection by the public free of charge—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at the office of the Secretary during normal office hours; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any other manner the Board thinks fit.

subsection.leadIn: There shall be a Pharmacy and Poisons Appeal Tribunal (in this Ordinance referred to as the Tribunal) with jurisdiction to hear and determine—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any appeal against a decision of the Board under section 13(3) or (7); (Replaced 58 of 1986 s. 10)

paragraph.name: aa
paragraph.content: any appeal against a decision or direction of the Board under section 25(2A), (3), (3A) or (3B); (Added 58 of 1986 s. 10. Amended 2 of 2015 s. 25)

paragraph.name: ab
paragraph.content: any appeal against a decision of the Board under any regulations made under section 29; and (Added 2 of 2015 s. 25)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: any appeal against—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: a decision of the Board in the performance by the Board under section 4A(8) of any function of a committee of the Board which, if made by the committee in exercise of such functions, would be a decision to which subparagraph (i) applies.

subsection.leadIn: The Tribunal shall consist of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the following persons appointed by the Chief Executive to be members thereof— (Amended 60 of 2000 s. 3)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a legally qualified person who shall be the chairman of the Tribunal;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a registered medical practitioner;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a registered pharmacist;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: a person qualified in pharmacology;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: such person from the panel referred to in subsection (3)(b) as the Director may nominate from time to time to act as a member representing the pharmaceutical industry; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: such person from the panel referred to in subsection (3)(c) as the Director may nominate from time to time to act as a member representing the retail pharmaceutical trade.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (2)(b), (c) and (d), the Chief Executive may appoint— (Amended 60 of 2000 s. 3)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a panel consisting of persons nominated by pharmacists’ associations;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a panel consisting of persons nominated by pharmaceutical industry associations; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a panel consisting of persons nominated by the retail pharmaceutical trade associations,

subsection.continued: and may at any time terminate any such appointment or make any alternative or additional appointment as he may deem fit.

subsection.content: A person appointed to be a member of the Tribunal under subsection (2)(a) shall hold office for such period not exceeding 3 years as the Chief Executive may determine, and may resign at any time by notice in writing addressed to the Chief Executive. (Amended 60 of 2000 s. 3)

A person nominated by the Director to act as a member of the Tribunal under subsection (2)(b), (c) or (d) shall hold such office during any period for which he is so nominated to act, and such person may resign from the panel of which he is a member at any time by notice in writing addressed to the Chief Executive. (Amended 60 of 2000 s. 3)

If the chairman of the Tribunal is unable to attend at the hearing of any appeal, such other member of the Tribunal appointed under subsection (2)(a) as the Director may designate to act as chairman shall preside at the hearing.

The Tribunal may act notwithstanding any vacancy in its membership and, for the purpose of hearing and determining any appeal under this section, the Tribunal shall be duly constituted if it consists of the chairman (or the member designated under subsection (6) to act as chairman) and not less than 2 other members sitting together throughout the hearing and determination.

subsection.name: 7A
subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: at the time of the member’s resignation or expiry of his term of office the hearing of an appeal under this section is continuing,

subsection.continued: then for the purpose of hearing and determining the appeal—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: the member shall continue to hold office; and

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: the appointment or nomination of any person to the office previously held by the member shall take effect subject to this subsection. (Added 6 of 1989 s. 2)

subsection.name: 7B
subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at the date of the commencement of the Pharmacy and Poisons (Amendment) Ordinance 1989 (6 of 1989) the hearing of an appeal under this section is continuing; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a member of the Tribunal hearing the appeal resigned or his term of office expired after the commencement of the hearing,

subsection.continued: then for the purpose of hearing and determining the appeal the member shall be deemed to continue to hold office until the appeal is determined; and the appointment or nomination of any person to the office previously held by the member shall have effect subject to this provision. (6 of 1989 s. 3 incorporated)

subsection.content: The Tribunal may examine any person as a witness on oath or otherwise, and may summon any person to attend and give evidence or to produce any document relating to any appeal before the Tribunal, as the Tribunal may deem necessary for the determination of the appeal.

In determining any appeal under this section, the Tribunal may dismiss the appeal or allow the appeal wholly or in part, and may, subject to regulations made under subsection (10), in either case give such reasons for its decision as it may deem fit.

subsection.leadIn: The Secretary for Health may make regulations— (Amended 68 of 1995 s. 31; L.N. 106 of 2002; L.N. 130 of 2007; L.N. 144 of 2022)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: regulating appeals under this section and the practice and procedure of the Tribunal;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: prescribing fees in respect of such appeals and matters connected therewith.

subsection.def: In this section the Director (署長) means the Director of Health. (Amended L.N. 76 of 1989)

section.name: s30A
section.heading: Right of appeal to Court of First Instance
section.content: Any person whose appeal is dismissed or allowed in part only by the Tribunal under section 30 may, not later than 28 days after the decision of the Tribunal, appeal to the Court of First Instance against that decision.
section.sourceNote: (Added 50 of 1980 s. 8. Amended 25 of 1998 s. 2; 10 of 2008 s. 25)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of advising the Board on the classification and distribution of poisons in Part 1 and Part 2 of the Poisons List and matters relating to the control of the manufacture and distribution of poisons and pharmaceutical products, there shall be a Poisons Committee consisting of— (Amended E.R. 4 of 2015)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the registered medical practitioner appointed under section 3(2)(h); and (Amended 2 of 2015 s. 26)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: 5 other members of the Board appointed by the Board, including 2 of the members appointed under section 3(2)(g).

subsection.content: In determining the distribution of poisons in Part 1 and Part 2 of the Poisons List the Board shall, after considering the advice of the Poisons Committee, have regard to the desirability of restricting to Part 2 substances which are in common use, or are likely to come into common use, and which it is reasonably necessary to include in the said Part 2 if the public are to have adequate facilities for obtaining them. (Amended E.R. 4 of 2015)

section.name: s32
section.heading: Exemption with respect to sales wholesale and sales to certain persons
section.leadIn: Except as provided by regulations, nothing in this Ordinance shall extend to or interfere with—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the sale of poisons by way of wholesale dealing; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the sale of poisons to be exported by a person referred to in section 28A(2) to purchasers outside Hong Kong; or (Amended 50 of 1980 s. 9; 60 of 2000 s. 3; 2 of 2015 s. 27)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the sale of a substance to a registered medical practitioner, registered dentist or registered veterinary surgeon for the purpose of his profession; or (Amended 96 of 1997 s. 42)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the sale or supply of a substance for use in or in connection with an institution; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: the sale of a substance by a person carrying on a business, in the course of which poisons are regularly sold to either—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a person who requires the substance for the purpose of his trade or business; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a Government department or an officer of the Government requiring the substance for the purpose of the public service; or (Amended 60 of 2000 s. 3)

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a person or institution concerned with education or scientific research, if the substance is required for the purposes of that education or research.

subsection.content: Any person who contravenes section 21, 23, 26, 27, 28 or 28A shall be guilty of an offence. (Amended 2 of 2015 s. 28)

subsection.leadIn: In the case of proceedings against a person under this Ordinance for or in connection with the sale, exposure for sale or supply of a poison effected by an employee—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it shall not be a defence that the employee acted without the authority of the employer; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any material fact known to the employee shall be deemed to have been known to the employer.

subsection.content: Notwithstanding any provision in any Ordinance prescribing the period within which summary proceedings may be commenced, proceedings for an offence under this Ordinance may be commenced at any time within the period of 12 months next after the date of the commission of the offence.

section.name: s34
section.heading: Penalty
section.content: Any person who is guilty of an offence under this Ordinance shall, unless a penalty is otherwise expressly provided, be liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 2 years.

section.name: s34A
section.heading: Recovery of costs and expenses of collecting or analysing poisons or pharmaceutical products etc.

subsection.content: If a person is convicted of an offence under this Ordinance, the court may order the person to pay to the Government the sum the court considers appropriate for the costs and expenses reasonably incurred by the Government in relation to the collection, analysis or examination of a poison, pharmaceutical product or any other substance for the purpose of the criminal proceedings.
A sum ordered to be paid under subsection (1) is recoverable as a civil debt.
To avoid doubt, this section does not affect any power conferred on the court under the Costs in Criminal Cases Ordinance (Cap. 492).
The Chairman may authorize in writing any public officer to be an inspector for the purposes of this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: An inspector authorized under this section shall, for the purpose of enforcing the provisions of this Ordinance, have power— (Amended 45 of 1975 s. 3)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: at all reasonable times to enter—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any premises which are on the register of premises; and
any premises at which any listed seller of poisons carries on business; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the premises of a person licensed to sell or supply poisons wholesale on such premises in accordance with regulations made under section 29; and

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: any premises where the dispensing or manufacturing of pharmaceutical products is carried on;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: upon the production of his authority as an inspector, at any time to enter and search any place and to stop, board and search any vessel, vehicle, train or aircraft in which he has reason to suspect that an offence under this Ordinance is being or has been committed;

paragraph.name: c
d
e
paragraph.content: to seize and detain any substance or article consisting of or containing any poison which he has reasonable cause to suspect is in the possession of any person in contravention of section 23.

subsection.content: Any person who wilfully delays or obstructs an inspector in the exercise of any powers under this section, or refuses to allow any sample to be taken in accordance with this section, or fails without reasonable excuse to give any information which he is duly required under this section to give shall be guilty of an offence.

Any person appearing to an inspector to be in charge of premises where a business which includes the sale of poisons is conducted shall be guilty of an offence if, without reasonable excuse, he fails to disclose particulars sufficient to identify the owner of the business upon being required so to do by the inspector.

Nothing in this section shall authorize an inspector appointed under this Ordinance to enter or inspect the premises of a registered medical practitioner, a registered dentist or a registered veterinary surgeon, other than those premises where the dispensing, manufacturing or compounding of pharmaceutical products is carried on. (Amended 96 of 1997 s. 43)

Any magistrate may, on application by the Government, order to be forfeited any pharmaceutical product or medicine or any substance or article consisting of or containing any poison with respect to which any offence under this Ordinance has been committed, whether any person has been convicted of such offence or not, and upon the making of any order of forfeiture such substance or article shall be deemed to be the property of the Government free from all rights of any person. (Amended 58 of 1986 s. 11; 60 of 2000 s. 3)

In any proceedings on application under subsection (1), any statement or other indication of the nature of any substance or article written upon or attached to any substance, article or container shall, until the contrary is proved, be deemed to be a true description of the substance or article or of the contents of the container, as the case may be.

section.name: s37
section.heading: Ordinance not to apply to Chinese herbal medicines and proprietary Chinese medicines, etc.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), nothing in this Ordinance shall apply to the sale, manufacturing, dispensing or compounding of Chinese herbal medicines or proprietary Chinese medicines as defined in section 2 of the Chinese Medicine Ordinance (Cap. 549) or other materials of herbal, animal or mineral origin customarily used by the Chinese for medicinal purpose.

Notwithstanding subsection (1), this Ordinance shall apply to pharmaceutical products containing any such Chinese herbal medicines or proprietary Chinese medicines or other materials of herbal, animal or mineral origin customarily used by the Chinese for medicinal purpose as active ingredients.

section.name: s38
section.heading: Amendment of Schedule
section.content: The Director of Health may, by notice published in the Gazette, amend the Schedule.
